content.raw:
When i try to build a ROS plugin (following [this](http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=ros_plugins) tutorial), i get the error message:

```
#!bash
This file was generated by an older version of protoc which is 
incompatible with your Protocol Buffer headers.  Please 
regenerate this file with a newer version of protoc.

```
The output of `dpkg -l | grep protobuf` is
```
ii  libarcus3                                     3.1.0-1ubuntu1                                    amd64        message queue for Cura based on protobuf (shared library)
ii  libprotobuf-dev:amd64                         3.6.0-0~201811272135~rev1785~pkg277~ubuntu18.04.1 amd64        protocol buffers C++ library (development files)
ii  libprotobuf-java                              3.6.0-0~201811272135~rev1785~pkg277~ubuntu18.04.1 all          Java bindings for protocol buffers
ii  libprotobuf-lite10:amd64                      3.0.0-9.1ubuntu1                                  amd64        protocol buffers C++ library (lite version)
ii  libprotobuf-lite17:amd64                      3.6.0-0~201811272135~rev1785~pkg277~ubuntu18.04.1 amd64        protocol buffers C++ library (lite version)
ii  libprotobuf10:amd64                           3.0.0-9.1ubuntu1                                  amd64        protocol buffers C++ library
ii  libprotobuf17:amd64                           3.6.0-0~201811272135~rev1785~pkg277~ubuntu18.04.1 amd64        protocol buffers C++ library
ii  protobuf-compiler                             3.6.0-0~201811272135~rev1785~pkg277~ubuntu18.04.1 amd64        compiler for protocol buffer definition files
ii  python3-arcus                                 3.1.0-1ubuntu1                                    amd64        message queue for Cura based on protobuf (Python bindings)
ii  python3-protobuf                              3.6.0-0~201811272135~rev1785~pkg277~ubuntu18.04.1 amd64        Python3 bindings for protocol buffers

```

I am using `gazebo version 9.0.0` installed via `ros-melodic-desktop-full` on Ubuntu 18.04.

Please let me know, if further information is needed.
content.html:
When i try to build a ROS plugin (following this tutorial), i get the error message:

This file was generated by an older version of protoc which is 
incompatible with your Protocol Buffer headers.  Please 
regenerate this file with a newer version of protoc.

The output of dpkg -l | grep protobuf is

ii  libarcus3                                     3.1.0-1ubuntu1                                    amd64        message queue for Cura based on protobuf (shared library)
ii  libprotobuf-dev:amd64                         3.6.0-0~201811272135~rev1785~pkg277~ubuntu18.04.1 amd64        protocol buffers C++ library (development files)
ii  libprotobuf-java                              3.6.0-0~201811272135~rev1785~pkg277~ubuntu18.04.1 all          Java bindings for protocol buffers
ii  libprotobuf-lite10:amd64                      3.0.0-9.1ubuntu1                                  amd64        protocol buffers C++ library (lite version)
ii  libprotobuf-lite17:amd64                      3.6.0-0~201811272135~rev1785~pkg277~ubuntu18.04.1 amd64        protocol buffers C++ library (lite version)
ii  libprotobuf10:amd64                           3.0.0-9.1ubuntu1                                  amd64        protocol buffers C++ library
ii  libprotobuf17:amd64                           3.6.0-0~201811272135~rev1785~pkg277~ubuntu18.04.1 amd64        protocol buffers C++ library
ii  protobuf-compiler                             3.6.0-0~201811272135~rev1785~pkg277~ubuntu18.04.1 amd64        compiler for protocol buffer definition files
ii  python3-arcus                                 3.1.0-1ubuntu1                                    amd64        message queue for Cura based on protobuf (Python bindings)
ii  python3-protobuf                              3.6.0-0~201811272135~rev1785~pkg277~ubuntu18.04.1 amd64        Python3 bindings for protocol buffers

I am using gazebo version 9.0.0 installed via ros-melodic-desktop-full on Ubuntu 18.04.

Please let me know, if further information is needed.
